snippet.title: CERN’s surveyors send sparks flying Les géomètres font des étincelles
snippet.description: CERN’s surveyors send sparks flying Les géomètres font des étincelles / Anaïs Schaeffer A few weeks ago, we published an article on the three-dimensional laser scanner technique used at CERN to produce 3D images of the LHC tunnels and experiments (see the article here). Photogrammetry is another technique in the CERN surveyors’ arsenal. [...] BUL-NA-2013-258.- 2013 \- Published in : CERN Bulletin 50/2013 51/2013 Fulltext: ATLAS_Photogrammetrie3_image \- JPG; ATLAS_Photogrammetrie3_1_image \- JPG; ATLAS_Photogrammetrie2-3_image \- JPG; ATLAS_Photogrammetrie2-4_image \- JPG; AMS_Rotating3-2_image \- JPG;

snippet.title: LS1 Report: operations on the right track Dernières nouvelles du LS1 : les opérations vont bon train
snippet.description: LS1 Report: operations on the right track Dernières nouvelles du LS1 : les opérations vont bon train / Simon Baird The SMACC interconnection train continues to progress in Sector 5-6 of the LHC, where the re-soldering of the opened M-lines has started (see picture 2). The interconnection teams are now also starting work in Sector 6-7, preparing and opening the interconnection bellows etc. [...] BUL-NA-2013-111.- 2013 \- Published in : CERN Bulletin 23/2013 24/2013 Fulltext: Travaux_image \- JPG; M_lines_1_image \- JPG; M_lines_image \- JPG; Reservoir_image \- JPG;

snippet.title: Fixing PowerPoint Annoyances : How to Fix the Most Annoying Things About Your Favorite Presentation Program
snippet.description: Fixing PowerPoint Annoyances : How to Fix the Most Annoying Things About Your Favorite Presentation Program / Swinford, Echo If you're vexed and perplexed by PowerPoint, pick up a copy of Fixing PowerPoint Annoyances [...] Sebastopol : O'Reilly Media, Inc, 2006. - 326 p. ebook

snippet.title: “Draw me a physicist” exhibition opens « Dessine-moi un physicien » s’expose
snippet.description: “Draw me a physicist” exhibition opens « Dessine-moi un physicien » s’expose / CERN Bulletin From 12 to 23 June, the Globe of Science and Innovation will be hosting the “Draw me a physicist” exhibition: over 160 drawings and definitions that illustrate how children see the world of research. In a child’s imagination, scientists are colourful, slightly eccentric figures with unusual powers. [...] BUL-NA-2010-139.- 2010 \- Published in : CERN Bulletin 23/2010 24/2010 Fulltext: Unknown_image \- JPEG; Unknown-1_image \- JPEG; Unknown-2_image \- JPEG;
